comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Winifred Sackville Stoner (c1870-1931), "Mother Stoner": en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winifred_Sackville_Stoner Her daughter was Winifred Sackville Stoner Jr. (1902-1983), a child prodigy; I suppose the girl in this photo could be 12-13, but it's a stretch. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winifred_Sackville_Stoner,_Jr. The younger Winifred is credited with writing the didactic poem that begins "In fourteen hundred ninety-two, Columbus sailed the ocean blue...."
